TextBlock.Text: RAVA: This is amazing! And, also unsettling. This wasn't here when I first arrived.
JAI: I'd love to say it isn't complicated, but it is. I'll spare you the details.
RAVA: Oh, please, tell me. I'm curious.
JAI: To put it simply, there used to be four accessible dimensions: up-down, left-right, forward-back, and future-past. But now we have discovered the next dimension, the 5th spatial dimension.
Every object has a 5th-dimensional "shadow." this "shadow" is a near-infinite extension of the object, but we can't normally see it, let alone access it.
We have simply moved a few inches through the 5th dimension. if we mine all this away we just need to go a bit further.
RAVA: You mean we're standing exactly where we were, just off by a few inches?
JAI: Yes, and in the fifth dimension, although we can't picture it in our minds, we have access to theoretically infinite amounts of metal.
RAVA: But how did we move at all?
JAI: A fish can't conceive of moving through the air, but with a hook, they travel nonetheless.
RAVA: Thats what you're calling it, a hook... That kind of makes sense. Now how do we get out?
